effective_dosage: 0.5% and 1% Aloe vera gel extract administered in fresh drinking water.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the in-vitro antioxidant effects, acute oral toxicity, and in-vivo anti-diabetic activity of standardized deep red Aloe vera flowers methanolic extracts (AVFME), including histological examination of the pancreas.
results_summary: AVFME showed strong antioxidant effects comparable to ascorbic acid, demonstrated safety with no toxicity signs or death at various doses, and significantly reduced blood glucose levels in diabetic rats, comparable to glibenclamide but without severe hypoglycemia or weight gain. Histological examination confirmed pancreatic beta-cell protection.
population_specificity: Albino rats (alloxan-induced diabetic model).
effective_dosage: 200 mg/kg, 500 mg/kg (anti-diabetic study); 200 mg/kg, 2, 4, 8, 10 g/kg (toxicity study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of standardized Aloe vera gel capsules on quality of life and clinical outcomes in patients with systolic heart failure.
results_summary: The study found that Aloe vera significantly improved quality of life (MLHFQ), NYHA functional class, sleep quality, and reduced insomnia and sleep apnea severity, with fewer adverse events compared to placebo. The 6-minute walk test showed improvement but was not statistically significant.
population_specificity: Patients with systolic heart failure (42 participants).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize gold nanoparticles (AuNPs) using Aloe vera extract and evaluate their potential for drug conjugation and cytotoxicity in breast cancer treatment.
results_summary: Aloe vera extract successfully synthesized stable AuNPs with antioxidant properties, which were conjugated with anticancer drugs and demonstrated cytotoxicity against MCF7 and MDA-MB-231 breast cancer cells.
population_specificity: In vitro (MCF7 and MDA-MB-231 breast cancer cell lines)
effective_dosage: Not specified for Aloe vera extract alone; gold salt concentrations of 0.5, 1, 2, and 3 mM were used.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the alkalinity effects of aloe vera and curcumin with calcium hydroxide on external root surface defects in an in vitro setting.
results_summary: Aloe vera demonstrated higher alkalinity than curcumin and calcium hydroxide, particularly after 14, 21, and 28 days, showing statistically significant differences (P<0.05).
population_specificity: Permanent teeth with single root canals (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of Aloe vera-incorporated hybrid nanoflowers (AV-Nfs) for wound healing applications, focusing on their antimicrobial, antioxidant, and cell proliferation effects.
results_summary: AV-Nfs demonstrated enhanced peroxidase-mimicking activity, antioxidant properties, and significant wound closure compared to free Aloe vera. They also showed antimicrobial activity against several bacterial strains but no effect against Candida albicans.
population_specificity: In vitro study using CCD-1072Sk fibroblast cell line and bacterial/yeast strains.
effective_dosage: 2 mL concentration for optimal nanoflower morphology; 625 μg/mL minimum inhibitory concentration for antimicrobial activity.

study_goal: To investigate the mechanism of polysaccharides from aloe vera (PAV) in treating pulpitis in rats and its effects on inflammation and osteoblast differentiation.
results_summary: PAV reduced inflammation and necrosis in pulpitis rats, upregulated bone mineral density, and promoted osteoblast differentiation by modulating the Wnt/β-catenin signaling pathway, with dose-dependent effects.
population_specificity: Sprague Dawley rats with induced pulpitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Aloe vera could mitigate the adverse effects of aflatoxin B1 (AFB1) on performance, serum biochemistry, and liver health in laying hens.
results_summary: Aloe vera improved egg production, egg weight, and eggshell thickness in hens fed AFB1-contaminated diets, though not significantly. It also normalized serum biochemical markers (cholesterol, uric acid, AST, ALT) and reduced liver histopathological damage caused by AFB1.
population_specificity: White Leghorn laying hens (Hy-Line W-36)
effective_dosage: 100 ppm and 300 ppm Aloe vera powder mixed into feed

study_goal: To study the effect of eyedrops containing Aloe Vera, hyaluronic acid, and Centella asiatica on the quality of life of patients with dry eye disease (DED).
results_summary: The study evaluated the impact of the treatment on quality of life using the OSDI questionnaire, adherence, and safety, but specific results regarding Aloe Vera's effects were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients with dry eye disease (DED).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of aloe vera mouthwash against green tea, chlorhexidine, and a control group in managing dental biofilm-induced gingivitis.
results_summary: Aloe vera mouthwash showed the least percentage change in plaque index and gingival index compared to other groups, indicating minimal efficacy. It performed slightly better than the control group for sulcular bleeding index but was less effective than chlorhexidine and green tea.
population_specificity: 18-40-year-old patients with generalized dental biofilm-induced gingivitis.
effective_dosage: Not specified (only mentioned as "aloe vera mouthwash").

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential mechanisms underlying the anti-NASH effects of Aloe vera using network pharmacology and molecular docking approaches.
results_summary: The study identified 260 common targets between Aloe vera and NASH, linking them to key pathological processes like lipid/glucose metabolism, inflammation, and liver fibrosis. Molecular docking confirmed interactions between Aloe vera's active compounds and core proteins (AKT1, TNFα, c-Jun, p53), supporting its multi-target, multi-pathway action against NASH.
population_specificity: Animal models (not explicitly stated, but implied by "protective effects against NASH in animals").

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the effects of aloe vera on the treatment of oral ulcers, comparing its clinical outcomes to other interventions.
results_summary: Aloe vera showed better clinical efficacy and shorter healing time compared to controls, though it was comparable in pain relief and ulcer size reduction. The study noted high safety with almost no side effects.
population_specificity: Patients with oral ulcers (847 participants across 9 trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of aloe vera extract, alone and in combination with turmeric extract, in extending the shelf life of goat milk paneer under refrigeration.
results_summary: The study found that aloe vera extract, especially when combined with turmeric extract, significantly suppressed physicochemical deterioration, reduced oxidative and microbial degradation, and better maintained sensory attributes in paneer during storage. The combination treatment (T3) showed superior results compared to aloe vera alone (T2) or control.
population_specificity: Goat milk paneer (food product)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether aloenin A, a glycoside found in Aloe vera, could inhibit pancreatic lipase activity in vitro and in silico as a potential treatment for obesity.
results_summary: The study found that Aloe vera extract and aloenin A effectively inhibited pancreatic lipase, with IC50 values of 0.5472 μg/ml and 14.95 μg/mL, respectively. Molecular docking studies supported these findings, showing aloenin A binds competitively to the enzyme's active site.
population_specificity: In vitro and in silico (no human or animal subjects specified)
effective_dosage: IC50 values provided (0.5472 μg/ml for A. vera extract, 14.95 μg/mL for aloenin A)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential role of Aloe vera and its active components in alleviating diabetic dyslipidemia and their mechanism of action in pre-clinical and clinical studies.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that Aloe vera has traditional uses for various biological activities, including hypoglycemic and anti-inflammatory effects, but notes limited studies on its role in diabetic dyslipidemia. The systematic review focuses on its potential benefits and mechanisms in this context.
population_specificity: Individuals with type 2 diabetes mellitus and dyslipidemia (pre-clinical and clinical studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy, safety, and mechanism of topical aloe vera gel (AVG) in treating diabetic chronic cutaneous ulcers in Bama miniature pigs.
results_summary: AVG shortened wound healing time in diabetic pigs, with alternate-day treatment showing faster healing than daily treatment. No adverse reactions were observed, and the mechanism may involve regulation of specific microRNAs.
population_specificity: Bama miniature pigs with diabetic chronic skin wounds.
effective_dosage: Daily (AVG QD) and every-other-day (AVG QOD) administration.
study_duration: Until complete wound healing (specific duration not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential obesity-preventing function of Aloe vera-fermented beverages (AFB) in high-fat diet-induced obesity models.
results_summary: AFB reduced lipid droplets in HepG2 cells, suppressed weight gain and fat accumulation in mice, lowered serum cholesterol and inflammatory markers, and altered gut microbiota composition by decreasing Firmicutes/Bacteroidetes ratio and increasing beneficial bacteria.
population_specificity: HepG2 cells (in vitro) and high-fat diet-fed mice (in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of Aloe vera gel, coconut oil, and cold cream on wound healing in rats.
results_summary: Aloe vera gel significantly enhanced wound healing compared to coconut oil and cold cream, as evidenced by clinical, histopathological, and biochemical evaluations. The results suggest Aloe vera gel may be a viable treatment for open wounds.
population_specificity: Wistar albino rats with full-thickness open skin wounds.
effective_dosage: Topical application twice daily (specific amount not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of Aloe vera on relieving irritation and nipple pain in lactating women.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found a statistically significant positive impact of Aloe vera on reducing breast pain and irritation in lactating women, with moderate effect sizes. Heterogeneity was high for pain studies but low for irritation studies.
population_specificity: Lactating women experiencing nipple pain or irritation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of an Aloe vera fentanyl patch on adhesion, local tolerance, pain control, and quality of life compared to a standard fentanyl patch.
results_summary: The Aloe vera fentanyl patch showed better adhesion, improved systemic and local tolerance, and significantly better pain reduction compared to the standard patch. Patients also reported fewer side effects and enhanced quality of life.
population_specificity: 252 patients with chronic pain, including 92 with prior fentanyl patch treatment, across 54 centers in Germany.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the biological effects of Aloe Vera and other natural products in controlling subgingival biofilm in patients with periodontitis.
results_summary: Aloe Vera demonstrated antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory activities, showing promising results against microorganisms related to periodontitis. It was identified as a potential adjunctive therapy for oral hygiene.
population_specificity: Patients with periodontitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of Aloe vera gel versus amlexanox 5% oral paste in treating recurrent small-type aphthous ulcers.
results_summary: Aloe vera gel significantly reduced ulcer size and pain compared to both amlexanox and placebo by the fifth day of treatment, demonstrating superior efficacy.
population_specificity: 60 patients (15-25 years old) with recurrent small-type aphthous ulcers, attending a dental clinic in Damascus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of Aloe vera (AV) and Rheum palmatum root (RPR) on oral wound healing capacity in vitro, focusing on fibroblast migration and antimicrobial activity.
results_summary: AV increased fibroblast migration and showed synergistic effects with RPR in enhancing cellular migration and antibacterial efficacy against Porphyromonas gingivalis. The combination did not influence cell cycle distribution.
population_specificity: Human primary fibroblasts and the oral pathogen Porphyromonas gingivalis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of Aloe vera combined with carbon-based nanomaterials as an antineoplastic agent for treating and preventing melanoma.
results_summary: The study suggests that Aloe vera, particularly its compounds like aloin and aloe-emodin, shows promising antineoplastic activity when combined with carbon nanoparticles, offering new possibilities for melanoma treatment. However, the abstract does not provide specific clinical outcomes or statistical results.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on melanoma treatment in general).

study_goal: To evaluate the acute impact of a nutraceutical blend containing Aloe Vera on immune surveillance and antioxidant activity in healthy subjects.
results_summary: Consumption of the APR extract (containing Aloe Vera) triggered rapid increases in chemokine levels, immune cell activation markers, and antioxidant enzyme activity, suggesting enhanced immune surveillance and cellular protection. The effects were transient, peaking at 2-3 hours post-consumption.
population_specificity: 11 healthy subjects

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential therapeutic activities of Aloe vera and its bioactive compounds, particularly in cancer prevention and treatment.
results_summary: The study highlights Aloe vera's bioactive compounds and their mechanisms of action in cancer prevention and treatment, suggesting potential therapeutic and preventive effects against neoplastic diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified (pre-clinical studies implied)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of aloe vera in managing prediabetes and early non-treated diabetes mellitus.
results_summary: Aloe vera supplementation significantly reduced fasting blood glucose, HbA1c, triglycerides, total cholesterol, and LDL-C, while increasing HDL-C levels. Only one adverse event was reported, but the study noted limited evidence on safety and inconclusive results due to small sample sizes and poor-quality RCTs.
population_specificity: Prediabetes and early non-treated diabetic patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impact of acemannan (from Aloe vera) on guided bone regeneration (GBR) with simultaneous implant placement.
results_summary: Acemannan significantly improved dimensional stability of regenerated tissue at 3 months but showed no statistically significant difference at 6 months. It was found to be a safe and predictable biomaterial for GBR.
population_specificity: 20 patients undergoing guided bone regeneration with simultaneous implant placement.
effective_dosage: Particulate acemannan (mean size 32.45 μm) mixed with deproteinized bovine bone.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Aloe Vera could serve as a safe and effective alternative treatment for oral submucous fibrosis compared to conventional therapy.
results_summary: Both Aloe Vera and the conventional treatment (hydrocortisone, hyaluronidase, and antioxidants) showed statistically significant improvements in symptoms like burning sensation, mouth opening, cheek flexibility, and tongue protrusion. Aloe Vera's clinical response was comparable to the conventional treatment.
population_specificity: 74 patients with oral submucous fibrosis.
effective_dosage: Systemic (juice) and topical (gel) Aloe Vera (specific amounts not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine whether Aloe Vera could help alleviate symptoms of psoriasis.
results_summary: The study suggests that Aloe Vera may be helpful in managing psoriasis, though the evidence is not strongly detailed or quantified. No specific outcomes or statistical significance are reported.
population_specificity: Patients with psoriasis (specific demographics not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of two Aloe vera products (UP780 and AC952) on fasting blood glucose, lipid profile, and oxidative stress in subjects with prediabetes/metabolic syndrome.
results_summary: AC952 significantly reduced total and LDL cholesterol, glucose, and fructosamine, while UP780 significantly lowered HbA1c, fructosamine, fasting glucose, insulin, HOMA, and oxidative stress markers compared to placebo.
population_specificity: 45 subjects with prediabetes (impaired fasting glucose or impaired glucose tolerance) and two other features of metabolic syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of dietary alpha-ketoglutarate (AKG) on behavior, energy metabolism, and oxidative stress markers in mice fed a high-fat high-fructose diet (HFFD).
results_summary: AKG supplementation promoted anxiety-like behavior, improved glutathione-dependent detoxification, and influenced autophagy-related processes, but showed mixed effects on enzyme activities and gene expression compared to HFFD alone.
population_specificity: Mice (murine model)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a bone-targeting nanocarrier loaded with Alpha-Ketoglutarate (AKG) could enhance AKG's bioavailability and therapeutic efficacy in treating osteoporosis.
results_summary: The study found that the nanocarrier (LMEK) significantly improved AKG's bone-targeting efficiency and therapeutic effects, reducing the required AKG dose to 0.2% of conventional treatment levels while enhancing osteogenic differentiation and inhibiting osteoclast activity in ovariectomized mice.
population_specificity: Ovariectomized osteoporosis mice models.
effective_dosage: Dose reduced to 0.2% of conventional AKG treatment (specific amount not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether α-ketoglutarate (αKG) potentiates the effects of SLC25A1 inhibition on DNA damage repair, cell function, and long-term survival in irradiated cancer cells.
results_summary: αKG enhanced the effects of SLC25A1 inhibition on DNA damage repair and cellular vulnerability to radiation, but alone had minimal impact. Nicotinamide (NAM) counteracted these effects, suggesting NAD+/NADH balance plays a role in survival post-irradiation.
population_specificity: NCI-H460 cancer cells (in vitro and in vivo).
interactions: Nicotinamide (NAM) counteracted the effects of SLC25A1 inhibition combined with αKG.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if α-ketoglutarate (α-KG) plays a role in metabolic and epigenetic changes in SLE monocytes, particularly in relation to ISG expression and trained immunity.
results_summary: The study found that SLE monocytes had increased levels of α-KG, which is linked to enhanced glycolysis and oxidative phosphorylation. α-KG acted as a cofactor for histone demethylases, influencing ISG expression and suggesting a role in trained immunity.
population_specificity: Patients with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and healthy volunteers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how Alpha-Ketoglutarate (α-KG) influences Lactobacillus reuteri growth and its role in alleviating ulcerative colitis (UC) via the α-KG-L. reuteri-epithelial regeneration axis.
results_summary: The study found that α-KG increased L. reuteri levels, enhanced energy metabolism, and alleviated mucosal damage in UC mice. It promoted L. reuteri growth by boosting α-KG dehydrogenase activity, supporting epithelial regeneration via the Wnt/β-catenin pathway.
population_specificity: Mice with dextran sulfate sodium-induced ulcerative colitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential of alpha-ketoglutarate (aKG) as a mitochondrial-targeting antioxidant in cancer cells, specifically its effects on mitochondrial activity, cell growth, and caspase-3 activity.
results_summary: aKG reduced mitochondrial activity and cell growth in MTC-SK cells in a concentration- and time-dependent manner, with an IC50 of 500 µg/mL after 72 hours. It also increased caspase-3 activity, indicating induced cell death, particularly in high-RONS-generating cancer cells.
population_specificity: MTC-SK and NCI-H23 cancer cell lines.
effective_dosage: 0-500 µg/mL aKG, with IC50 at 500 µg/mL after 72 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of alpha-ketoglutarate (αKG) in modulating immune evasion mechanisms and its potential to enhance immunotherapy efficacy in renal cell carcinoma (RCC).
results_summary: The study found that decreased αKG levels correlate with worse prognosis in RCC, while elevated αKG promotes MHC-I antigen presentation and B2M expression. Combining αKG supplementation with PD-1 blockade improved therapeutic outcomes in murine models compared to monotherapy.
population_specificity: Clinical RCC samples and murine models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if dietary supplementation with alpha-ketoglutarate (αKG) could suppress hyperactivation of platelets and leukocytes and reduce thromboinflammatory complications in type 2 diabetes (T2D).
results_summary: Dietary αKG supplementation significantly reduced activation of platelets and leukocytes, decreased inflammatory cytokines in blood and lungs, and suppressed thrombus formation in T2D mice and human blood samples. Octyl αKG also inhibited blood cell activation and thrombus formation in vitro.
population_specificity: Type 2 diabetic mice and human T2D patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Alpha-Ketoglutarate (α-KG) on cell growth and energy metabolism in C2C12 cell culture.
results_summary: Lower concentrations of α-KG (0.1 mM and 1.0 mM) increased cell growth and colony-forming efficiency, while higher concentrations (≥20 mM) led to rapid cell death. α-KG also reduced glucose consumption and ammonia production, suggesting improved glucose and glutamine metabolism.
population_specificity: C2C12 cell culture (mouse myoblast cell line).
effective_dosage: 0.1 mM, 1.0 mM, 10.0 mM, 20.0 mM, 30.0 mM, and 100 mM (latter caused cell death).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether supplementation with sustained-release Ca-AKG could reduce DNA methylation age in middle-aged individuals with a higher DNA methylation age compared to their chronological age.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide results, as it describes a planned randomized controlled trial (RCT) rather than reporting outcomes.
population_specificity: 40-60-year-old healthy individuals with a higher DNA methylation age than their chronological age.
study_duration: 6 months of intervention, with 3 months of follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the role of Alpha-Ketoglutarate (AKG) in myotube formation under normal and low glucose conditions and to explore its metabolic effects.
results_summary: AKG supplementation promoted myotube formation and induced metabolic remodeling, including improved energy metabolism and enhanced antioxidant capacity, particularly by altering amino acid metabolism and upregulating glycine levels and antioxidase expression.
population_specificity: C2C12 myoblasts cultured in normal and low glucose medium.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the regulation and function of αKG-dependent dioxygenases in breast cancer and explore potential therapeutic strategies targeting these enzymes.
results_summary: The study found that αKG-dependent dioxygenases play essential roles in cellular adaptation to hypoxia, epigenetic regulation, and metabolic reprogramming, and their dysregulation is implicated in cancer pathogenesis, particularly breast cancer. The review suggests these enzymes may offer new therapeutic intervention strategies.
population_specificity: Breast cancer (no specific patient demographics provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Alpha-Ketoglutarate (AKG) has protective effects on hyperlipidemia-induced endothelial injury and to elucidate its underlying mechanism.
results_summary: AKG administration significantly reduced hyperlipidemia-induced endothelial damage by regulating ET-1 and nitric oxide levels, lowering inflammatory markers, and mitigating oxidative stress and mitochondrial dysfunction via the ERK-Nrf2 signaling pathway.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vivo and in vitro models used).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether alpha-ketoglutarate (AKG) could reverse aberrant DNA methylation patterns and restore cardiac function in diabetic rats.
results_summary: AKG supplementation reversed abnormal methylation patterns in diabetic rat hearts, restored cardiac function, and normalized 5mC and 5hmC levels in high glucose-treated H9c2 cells.
population_specificity: Male adult Wistar rats with STZ-induced diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether α-ketoglutarate (α-KG) could improve the quality of aging oocytes in mice, both in vivo and in vitro.
results_summary: α-KG supplementation reduced ROS levels, decreased abnormal spindle assembly, improved mitochondrial membrane potential, and enhanced oocyte quality and early embryonic development in aging mice. These effects were consistent in both in vivo and in vitro settings.
population_specificity: Aging mice (in vivo) and post-ovulated aging oocytes (in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether alpha-ketoglutarate (α-KG) could improve ovarian morphology, reserve function, and fertility in rats with cyclophosphamide-induced premature ovarian insufficiency (POI).
results_summary: α-KG treatment improved body mass, ovarian index, estrous cycles, follicular preservation, ovarian reserve, pregnancy rates, and litter sizes in POI rats. It also reduced FSH levels, increased oestradiol, decreased granulosa cell apoptosis, and restored glycolysis-related markers.
population_specificity: Female Sprague Dawley rats with cyclophosphamide-induced POI.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of pyroptosis in paraquat-induced lung injury and explore potential protective mechanisms, including the effects of DMK (dimethyl alpha-ketoglutarate).
results_summary: The study found that paraquat induced pyroptosis via the caspase 3/GSDME pathway in BEAS-2B cells, and DMK suppressed this pyroptosis by blocking the pathway, reducing ROS levels, and improving mitochondrial function.
population_specificity: BEAS-2B cells (human bronchial epithelial cell line)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Alpha-Ketoglutarate (α-KG) supplementation could enhance the efficacy of anti-PD1 immunotherapy in melanoma by modulating PD-L1 expression and TET2/3-STAT1/3-CD274 signaling.
results_summary: The study found that α-KG supplementation increased PD-L1 expression in melanoma tumors via STAT1/3, enhanced TET2/3 activity, and elevated 5-hmC levels in the PD-L1 promoter, leading to improved anti-PD1 therapy efficacy. Clinical and preclinical data linked TET2/3-STAT1/3-CD274 signaling to anti-PD1 sensitivity.
population_specificity: Anti-PD1-sensitive melanoma-bearing mice and melanoma patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of α-ketoglutarate (αKG) in regulating gene expression in cancer cells and its potential as an anti-cancer therapeutic strategy targeting glutamine metabolism.
results_summary: The study found that αKG reduced the expression of immediate early genes (IEGs) in cancer cells via H3K27 acetylation, while glutaminase inhibitors increased IEG expression. Combining NR4A1 agonists with glutaminase inhibitors sensitized resistant cancer cells to death.
population_specificity: Several cancer cell lines (specific types not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether alpha-ketoglutarate (AKG) inhibits osteoclastogenesis and the underlying mechanism involving PHD1-dependent suppression of NF-κB signaling.
results_summary: The study found that DM-AKG (a cell-permeable AKG derivative) inhibits osteoclast differentiation by suppressing NF-κB signaling and oxidative phosphorylation, with PHD1 identified as a key mediator of this effect. DMOG, an AKG competitive inhibitor, reversed these effects, confirming the role of PHD1.
population_specificity: Primary bone marrow-derived macrophages (BMMs) and RAW264.7 cells (in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether Alpha-Ketoglutarate (AKG) could downregulate neutral endopeptidase (NEP) expression in cancer cells and explore its potential anti-cancer effects, including synergy with thiorphan.
results_summary: AKG downregulated NEP expression in aggressive osteosarcoma HOS cells, leading to growth inhibition. It also induced hypermethylation of H3K27, partially dependent on EZH2, though this did not affect NEP downregulation. Combining AKG with thiorphan enhanced growth inhibition in HOS cells.
population_specificity: Cells derived from cervical, colon, and osteosarcoma cancers, as well as normal epithelial cells and osteoblasts.
interactions: Thiorphan (NEP-specific inhibitor) showed synergistic effects with AKG.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of 5-FU on α-KGDHC activity and protein levels of E1 and E2 subunits in rat cardiac muscle.
results_summary: 5-FU administration stimulated myocardial α-KGDHC activity and increased E2 protein levels, while E1 levels remained unchanged. The up-regulation of α-KGDHC appeared linked to changes in E2 subunit protein levels.
population_specificity: Male Wistar rats
effective_dosage: 150 mg/kg body weight per dose (4 doses total)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Alpha-Ketoglutarate (AKG) could prevent or mitigate abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) formation by modulating oxidative stress and inflammation.
results_summary: AKG pre-treatment significantly reduced aneurysmal dilation, aortic rupture, macrophage infiltration, elastin degradation, and collagen remodeling in mice. It also decreased inflammatory cytokines, apoptosis, and oxidative stress in vascular smooth muscle cells, primarily by inhibiting the PXDN/HOCL/ERK signaling pathway.
population_specificity: Elastase-induced mouse model of AAA and TNF-α-treated vascular smooth muscle cells (VSMCs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the role of glutamate dehydrogenase (GDH) and its product, Alpha-Ketoglutarate (AKG), in isoprenaline-induced cardiac hypertrophy and its potential as a therapeutic target.
results_summary: The study found that GDH and AKG levels were elevated in cardiac hypertrophy, leading to mTOR activation and cardiomyocyte hypertrophy. GDH knockdown or mTOR inhibition attenuated hypertrophic responses, suggesting GDH and AKG as potential targets for hypertrophy-related cardiomyopathy.
population_specificity: Cultured cardiomyocytes and rat hearts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand how T-ALL cells rewire metabolic pathways, particularly the role of α-ketoglutarate (α-KG) in metabolic plasticity and resistance to TCA cycle-targeting drugs.
results_summary: The study found that T-ALL cells shift from oxidative decarboxylation to reductive carboxylation when the TCA cycle is disrupted, with α-KG-dependent dioxygenases playing a key role. Dual inhibition of the TCA cycle and TET demethylases showed additive efficacy in reducing tumor burden in zebrafish xenografts.
population_specificity: Human T-ALL cells and zebrafish xenografts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the role of Glul and alpha-ketoglutarate (α-KG) in regulating LPS-induced sepsis and explore potential therapeutic strategies.
results_summary: The study found that α-KG depletion via TLR4/NF-κB inhibits Glul expression, exacerbating sepsis, while replenishing α-KG alleviated sepsis severity in mice.
population_specificity: Mice with endotoxemia (LPS-induced sepsis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of alpha-ketoglutarate (aKG) on the metabolome, mucosal barrier, and colitis amelioration in a mouse model.
results_summary: aKG treatment altered metabolite profiles, enriched glutathione metabolism and the urea cycle, and promoted goblet cell differentiation, leading to a fortified mucus layer and reduced harmful metabolites in colitis-induced mice.
population_specificity: C57BL/6 male mice
study_duration: 3 weeks of aKG supplementation, followed by 7 days of DSS induction and 7 days of recovery

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether α-ketoglutarate (AKG) could induce synthetic lethality in IDH wildtype glioblastoma (GBM) cells when combined with BCAT1 inhibition.
results_summary: AKG selectively killed IDHWT GBM cells when BCAT1 was lost, causing mitochondrial dysfunction and depletion of cellular building blocks. This effect was reversed by BCAT1 reexpression or branched-chain α-ketoacid supplementation, demonstrating a targetable metabolic vulnerability.
population_specificity: Human isocitrate dehydrogenase (IDH) wildtype glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) cells and patient-derived IDHWT GBM tumors.
interactions: Gabapentin (BCAT1 inhibitor) enhanced AKG's synthetic lethal effect.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of dimethyl alpha-ketoglutarate (DMKG) supplementation on the developmental competence of ovine oocytes during in vitro maturation, particularly its antioxidative properties.
results_summary: DMKG supplementation at 3 mM significantly improved nuclear maturation, ATP synthesis, mitochondrial activity, and blastocyst development while reducing oxidative stress markers like ROS, DNA damage, and apoptosis in ovine oocytes. It also mitigated oxidative stress damage induced by H2O2.
population_specificity: Ovine (sheep) oocytes
study_duration: Duration of in vitro maturation (specific timeframe not stated)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if Rejuvant®, an alpha-ketoglutarate-based formulation, could reduce biological aging as measured by DNA methylation clocks in humans.
results_summary: The study found that participants taking Rejuvant® showed an average decrease in biological aging of 8 years, with statistically significant results (p-value=6.538x10-12). The supplement was particularly beneficial for chronologically and biologically older individuals.
population_specificity: 42 individuals (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of Alpha-Ketoglutarate (Alpha-KG) on skin hydration, barrier function, and its potential as a cosmetic ingredient, as well as the efficacy of yeast fermentation for Alpha-KG production.
results_summary: The study found that Alpha-KG significantly improved skin hydration, barrier function, and reduced wrinkles, with clinical improvements in skin firmness and gloss. Fermentation of rice with yeast was identified as an effective method for Alpha-KG production.
population_specificity: Human participants (clinical study) and in vitro keratinocyte cultures.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a novel biosensor to measure nuclear α-KG concentrations and investigate its role in regulating epigenetic enzymes during adipocyte differentiation.
results_summary: The study successfully developed a FRET-based biosensor to monitor nuclear α-KG levels, demonstrating that α-KG concentrations increased during early adipocyte differentiation and remained elevated. The probe effectively measured α-KG dynamics in living cells, providing insights into epigenetic regulation.
population_specificity: 3T3-L1 preadipocytes
effective_dosage: Dimethyl-2-oxoglutarate (dimethyl-2-OG) and citrate, doses not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of alpha-ketoglutarate on intestinal antioxidant capacity, immune response, and barrier functions in Songpu mirror carp after infection with Aeromonas hydrophila.
results_summary: Alpha-ketoglutarate supplementation significantly increased survival rates, enhanced immune enzyme activities (lysozyme, alkaline phosphatase, complement C4), improved antioxidant capacity, reduced pro-inflammatory cytokine expression, and strengthened intestinal barrier functions via TLR4/MyD88/NF-κB and MLCK signaling pathways.
population_specificity: Songpu mirror carp (average initial weight 6.54 ± 0.08 g)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to elucidate the metabolism, regulatory mechanism, and perspectives of α-ketoglutarate on macrophage polarization and its potential anti-inflammatory effects.
results_summary: The study found that α-ketoglutarate regulates macrophage polarization, promoting an anti-inflammatory M2 phenotype, which may help prevent and treat inflammatory diseases. The review highlights its potential as a therapeutic target for inflammation-related conditions.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of macrophage polarization mechanisms).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a rapid, cost-effective assay to measure PHD activity by monitoring α-ketoglutarate consumption, potentially adaptable for high-throughput applications.
results_summary: The study successfully optimized a 2,4-DNPH α-ketoglutarate assay, demonstrating its robustness for obtaining kinetic parameters of PHD2 and sensitivity for detecting PHD inhibitors, including those in clinical trials for CKD-induced anemia.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether high glucose conditions promote α-ketoglutarate (αKG) secretion and OXGR1-dependent PRR upregulation, impacting AngII formation and Na+ reabsorption in diabetic conditions.
results_summary: The study found that high glucose conditions increased urinary αKG and PRR expression, leading to augmented AngII levels and Na+ retention, which were prevented by OXGR1 antagonist montelukast (ML). αKG increased PRR expression, while ML, PKC inhibition, or Ca2+ depletion blocked this effect.
population_specificity: Streptozotocin (STZ)-induced diabetic mice and primary cultured inner medullary collecting duct (CD) cells.
interactions: Montelukast (OXGR1 antagonist) was noted to counteract αKG effects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether l-theanine induces browning of white adipose tissue (WAT) and combats diet-induced obesity in mice, with a focus on the role of α-ketoglutarate (α-KG) in this process.
results_summary: l-theanine increased α-KG levels in adipocytes, promoting Prdm16 expression and WAT browning via AMPK activation and DNA demethylation, leading to improved metabolic outcomes in obese mice.
population_specificity: High-fat diet-fed mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the beneficial effects of dietary alpha-ketoglutarate (aKG) on experimental colitis and explore its underlying molecular mechanisms.
results_summary: Dietary aKG supplementation reduced colitis symptoms, improved gut inflammation, enhanced macrophage polarization, strengthened intestinal barrier function, and shifted metabolism from glycolytic to oxidative.
population_specificity: Eight-week-old male C57BL/6 mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether α-ketoglutarate (αKG) negatively regulates osteoclastogenesis and could serve as a therapeutic strategy for osteoclast-activated diseases.
results_summary: The study found that αKG inhibited osteoclastogenesis in vitro and in vivo by upregulating Slc7a11, reducing ROS production, and acting as an epigenetic co-factor at the Slc7a11 promoter through histone demethylation and increased Nrf2 binding.
population_specificity: C57BL/6 mice (in vivo) and osteoclasts (in vitro)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether exogenous Alpha-Ketoglutarate (AKG) exerted an anti-cancer effect on osteosarcoma cell lines (Saos-2 and HOS) with TP53 mutations.
results_summary: AKG inhibited proliferation, blocked cell cycle progression at the G1 stage, induced apoptosis via caspase activation, and reduced metastatic potential by decreasing TGF-β and VEGF production in osteosarcoma cell lines.
population_specificity: Osteosarcoma cell lines (Saos-2 and HOS) with TP53 mutations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how alpha-ketoglutarate (aKG) impacts Wnt signaling, stemness, and tumor growth in colorectal cancer (CRC) models.
results_summary: aKG supplementation reduced Wnt signaling, promoted cellular differentiation, and significantly restricted tumor growth in CRC patient-derived organoids and in vivo models. It also rescued low-glutamine-induced stemness and Wnt hyperactivation.
population_specificity: Colorectal cancer models (APC mutant intestinal organoids, CRC patient-derived organoids, and in vivo CRC tumor models).
